text: Shirak Beyene (born 20 October 1996 in England) is an Eritrean-English footballer. ==Career== ===Iceland=== Shown the red card on the 59th minute as Huginn fell 0-2 to Magni mid-2011,3\. deild: Magni og KFS með sigra Fótbolti.net Beyene had to sit out for the next matchup.Úrskurður aganefndar: Forráðamaður Leiknis F. í 5 leikja bann Fótbolti.net ===International=== He was capped three times for Eritrea in 2013. On the Eritrean internationals going missing after each away game, he stated that the situation was not conducive to football and that the Eritrean National Football Federation would have to start from scratch every time.FIVE AWAY TRIPS 61 DEFECTIONS FourFourTwo (Pressreader.com) == References == == External links == * * 2014 Men’s Pro Soccer Combine Roster Category:Living people Category:1996 births Category:Eritrean footballers Category:Eritrea international footballers Category:Association football forwards Category:Eritrean expatriate footballers Category:Expatriate footballers in Iceland Category:Association football wingers Category:London Tigers F.C. players Category:Íþróttafélagið Huginn players Category:English people of Eritrean descent Category:Black English sportspeople Category:Footballers from Greater London
title: Sirak Beyene
